byline.contributor: Laurie Goodstein reported from New York, and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from Canterbury, England.
byline.original: By LAURIE GOODSTEIN and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA

abstract: Archbishops of Anglican Communion succeed in keeping church intact in week of tense meetings in Canterbury, England, over deep divisions, largely because 38 Anglican archbishops have voted to impose restrictions on Episcopal Church for allowing clergy to perform same-sex marriages.

headline.print_headline: For Now, Anglicans Avert Schism Over Gay Marriage
headline.main: For Now, Anglicans Avert Schism Over Gay Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

snippet: A truce was achieved when archbishops at a meeting in England voted resoundingly to impose restrictions for three years on the church’s American province, the Episcopal Church.
lead_paragraph: A truce was achieved when archbishops at a meeting in England voted resoundingly to impose restrictions for three years on the church’s American province, the Episcopal Church.
